intro: Protium tovarense, commonly known as the Tovarensé or Tovarense tree, is a species native to Madagascar. It is a member of the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and bark. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a leathery texture with a distinctive scent when crushed. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by oval-shaped fruits containing a single seed.
